intro: Pimpinella astilbifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Pimpinella astilbifolia is valued for its ornamental foliage and its role in supporting local pollinators.
